result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry J Pollard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early termination after 2 yrs provided def completes all conditions of probation without revocations or ATR.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Contact with TLP, TJP, TLP & MTP so ordered by family Court in cases 06PA05PJ & 01PA716. No physical discipline of any child by def.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $100 applied from bond from 15CF1852.  $168  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

defn's motion to modify bond.  Argument by Atty Schilling.  Argument by DDA Moeser.

$2,000 SIGNATURE BOND   RE- REFERRAL TO BMP
-  Upon signing the $2,000 signature bond, the defendant is ordered to report to the Bail Monitoring Program (BMP).  Defendant is to report there on the day of his release, or not later than 10:00 AM on the business day immediately following his release.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with BMP, a body only bench warrant shall be issued.  
- Defendant shall not be at 1223 S Thompson Dr in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not be at any school.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant may have indirect contact  with Renee M. or Jackie N through a third party soley for purposes of arranging for supervised contact with his daughters.
- Defendant may have supervised contact with his children, except TJP, DOB of 8-18-2001, if the mothers of his children consent to such contact.

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT RE-REFERRED TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $2,000 per case. The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a signature bond in the amount of $2,000.00 per case. 
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact with juveniles under the age of 18.
- Defendant shall not be at 1223 S Thompson Dr in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not be at any school.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- No contact with Renee M., Jackie N. and the four children TJP, TLP, TP and MTP.
